intro: Centaurea adulterina subsp. numantina, commonly known as the Numantina Bluet, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical studies.
